result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymundo Garcia Hernandez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

[MK] case called at 1:25pm. 
Defendant Raymundo Garcia Hernandez in court with Attorney Joseph F Fischer.   DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Sentencing arguments given by counsel.

The Court sentences Mr. Garcia Hernandez to:
--serve 8 months in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/Work-Release privileges; to commence forthwith
--92 days credit for time already served given
--Mr. Garcia is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety (without any alcohol or illegal drugs) in his system; non-compliance will result in permanent loss of Huber privileges without further process.
--if there are any financial obligations outstanding, then the clerk is to apply the Cash Bail to pay that amount.  Thereafter the clerk is to refund the remaining amount to the payor.

Case called at 10:13am.  Clerk - CRHI.    Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter for the Defendant.
Defendant Raymundo  Garcia Hernandez in court with attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court and counsel review case history, status and filings. 
The Court verifies that the State does not oppose the defense motion. 
Scheduling issues addressed by the Court and Counsel. 
The Court verifies that it is the intent of defendant to refuse probation.  
Court grants the defendant motion to refuse probations and orders probation terminated. 
Case continued for Sentencing Hrg. - 1/12/17 at 2pm.

Bail/bond arguments presented by Counsel. 
The Court orders a $500 CASH bond with conditions:
-No contact with M.J.K. (*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at any place where M.J.K. resides 
-No physical contact with any female under the age of 18 years
-Not to be alone with any female under the age of 18 years
-Bond to be posted by 12:30pm today. 

NEXT - (Notices to be mailed.)
Sentencing Hrg. - 1/12/17 at 2pm
Motion hearing on November 10, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Case called at 8:44 am [Clerk SH]
Defendant Raymundo Garcia Hernandez in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Monica J. Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Atty Fischer informs the Court that all medical records have been received and reviewed. After review, do believe there is a large portion that is relevant for trial; requests matter be set for other acts motion hearing
Upon questioning of the Court, Atty Fischer indicates that this will be 2 day trial even if the defense is not successful on motion
ADA Hall requests that matter also be set for trial in approximately 90 days, ADA Shock, the assigned prosecutor, also believes this will also be 2 day trial
Court informs Atty Fischer that It will allow him to file motion per Its regular standards
Court orders motion to be filed within 30 days - deadline is Monday, March 28th - Court further order that the deadline for any other motions that will take longer than 15 minutes is March - this to apply to both parties
Atty Fischer indicates that there is No Miranda Goodchild Issues; ADA Hall informs the Court that the State has filed all known discovery
Court reminds Mr. Garcia Hernandez that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect
Recess: 8:50 am

NEXT: (1) Schedule FSSC 5/17/16 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule JT 5/23-24/16 at 8:30 am - Send notices

Case called at 1:37 pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Raymundo  Garcia Hernandez in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Fred Svensson sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
ADA Shock informs the Court that the State has filed all treatment records that are relevant
Court informs parties that It has conducted in-camera review and is prepared to issue decision
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Shock indicates that he has not read reports, just received them and forwarded them to the Court
Atty Fischer informs the Court that child has been hospitalized
Court determines that materials should be made available to defense, there are some materials in the records that would be helpful to the defense in establishing a defense of the charge. Some of the issues addressed in the defendant's motions for release of the records do support release of the records themselves. Court directs the State to provide copy of all records to the Defense that were provided to the Court. Court prohibits any further dissemination - except for professional working on teams; law enforcement, psychologists or other mental health experts who are assisting the parties. Whoever distributes the records must inform verbally or in writing that the records must not be further disseminated or shared with any other parties. The defense attorney may allow the defendant to read the records however, the defense atty is not to make copies of the records for the defendant. The defendant may have as much time as he needs to read the records under the direction of the defense atty. The defendant and the defense atty are allowed to discuss the contents of the records between themselves, but the defendant is not to discuss the contents with any other persons. Violations of the order would be subject to contempt sanctions.

ADA Shock informs the Court that he did not keep any copies of the records.
Court directs the Clerk to provide copies to Atty Fischer and to ADA Shock of the submissions of the 8 providers. 
Counsel can meet with COC to be sure records are accurate. Atty Fischer requests that the Court allow him to share contents of reports with Miss Pempek in preparation of case, presents basis
ADA Shock: No objection as long as she does not maintain a copy of the records
Court has colloquy with Miss Jean F. Pempek; Court grants defense request & allows Miss Pempek to discuss reports with Atty Fischer and prepare with her as long as she does not maintain copy of report or discuss outside his presence or with any other persons.
Atty Fischer request the matter be set for status in approximately 30 - 45 days for time to review records; ADA Shock: Agreed
Court reminds Mr. Garcia Hernandez that his bond/conditions of release remain in effect while case is pending
Recess: 1:54 pm 

NEXT:  (1) Schedule STC - 2/12/16 at 2:30 pm - Send notices

Defendant Raymundo  Garcia Hernandez in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Case called at 11:23am [mo]
Defendant Raymundo Garcia Hernandez in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Elizabeth Barrera sworn as Spanish Interpreter

On the Defense's Motion for Release of Psychological Records:
--ADA Shock opposes the Motion in its current form
--Arguments as to the Motion given by Counsel 

After hearing arguments by Atty. Fischer, ADA Shock verifies the burden of proof has been met. 

Jean Pempek sworn and testifies 
--Direct examination by Attorney Fischer

ADA Shock proposes that Mr. Hernandez testify under oath the truthfulness of Paragraph 7 of the proposed Motion.

The Defendant, Raymundo Garcia Hernandez sworn and testifies
--Direct examination by Attorney Fischer 
ADA Shock concedes that, with the testimony of Mr. Garcia Hernandez the standard has been met. 

The Court grants the Defense's Motion for Release of Psychological Records

The Court orders the Victim Witness Coordinator with the State obtain the records and file them with the Court, the Court clarifies that this should include the records from the former counselor, Jeremy Birch and also current counselors. 
The Court intends to conduct an in- camera review 
ADA Shock estimates 4-6 weeks to obtain the records
The Court orders the records be submitted by 4/27/15 or provide an information to Court indicating the status of the records.
The records will remain under seal in the Court record until further review by the Court.
The Court reminds Mr. Garcia Hernandez of his bond and its conditions.
recess: 11:52am

case called at 2:13pm. [MK]
Defendant Raymundo Garcia Hernandez in court.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today.  ADA Teuber has indicated that the State is ready to proceed. 
The Court informs Mr. Garcia that it has reviewed his Petition for Appointment of Counsel, and the Court finds that, given Mr. Garcia's significant income and his having some equity in a home, Mr. Garcia does not qualify for court-appointed counsel. 
Mr. Garcia indicates that he has been in contact with an attorney, and he will continue efforts to hire counsel. 
The Court adjourns the hearing, informing Mr. Garcia of the new Preliminary Hearing date and time. 
recess 2:17pm.

** Minutes from 14GF51**

Case called at 1:20 pm
Raymundo Garcia Hernandez in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the State Public Defenders Office. Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Liesl Monroy sworn in as Spanish Interpreter.
Court reviews that a Probable Cause Statement was filed with the Court.
Court verifies with the Defendant that his DOB is 8/7/1962.
Reading of Probable Cause conducted.
The Court finds that there is probable cause.

Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint informs the Court that the State believes that they will be making a charging decision by tomorrow, and requests that the case be recalled at intake tomorrow.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-No contact with M.J.K. 
-No presence at any place where M.J.K. resides 
-No physical contact with any female he knows to be or would reasonably be expected to know to be under the age of 18 
-Not to be alone with any female he knows or would be reasonably be expected to know to be under the age of 18

Court orders that this bond will lapse if the State has not  filed a complaint within 5 days, that 5 days starts counting from 1:42 pm today.
Court orders if a complaint is filed that defendant will be brought before the Court for an initial appearance the same day as long as the complaint is filed before 1:15 pm, if filed after 1:15 pm the defendant is to be brought before the Court the next day. If the defendant posts bond the defendant will be summoned in for the initial appearance.

recess: 1:45 pm
